definitions: oval or round object laid by female birds containing developing offspring
female reproductive cell that can develop into a new organism
examples: She cracked three eggs into the mixing bowl
The hen laid fresh eggs every morning
The fertilized egg divided rapidly during early development
Scientists studied the egg cells under powerful microscopes

definitions: military officer of high rank typically commanding multiple units
affecting or concerning all or most people places or things
examples: The general addressed the troops before the mission
General Smith retired after forty years of service
The general opinion favored the new policy changes
These guidelines provide general principles for healthy living

definitions: look on someone's face that conveys particular emotion
mathematical symbol or formula representing quantity or operation
word or phrase used to communicate ideas or feelings
examples: Her expression showed complete surprise at the news
The child's joyful expression brightened everyone's mood
Simplify this algebraic expression to find the answer
The expression equals zero when x is three
That old expression perfectly captures the situation here
Freedom of expression remains a fundamental human right

definitions: period devoted to particular activity or formal meeting
time spent recording music in a professional studio environment
examples: The therapy session lasted exactly fifty minutes today
Congress held an emergency session to address concerns
The band booked a session to record their album
Studio session musicians often work with multiple artists

definitions: event or contest where people compete against each other
rivalry between businesses trying to gain customers or market share
examples: She won first place in the swimming competition
The annual competition attracts participants from many countries
Competition between tech companies drives innovation forward rapidly
Healthy competition benefits consumers through better prices overall

definitions: way of carrying out particular task using specialized skill
method of artistic expression or performance distinguishing individual creators
examples: The surgeon demonstrated a new surgical technique today
Proper breathing technique improves athletic performance significantly
Her painting technique combines traditional and modern approaches
The pianist's technique impressed even experienced music critics

definitions: usual or ordinary standard level or quality of something
number calculated by adding quantities together then dividing by count
examples: The average student completes homework in two hours
Their performance exceeded the average for their age
Calculate the average of these five test scores
The average temperature last month was unusually high

definitions: alcoholic drink made from fermented juice of grapes
dark red color resembling that of red wine
examples: They opened a bottle of wine with dinner
French wine remains popular among collectors worldwide
She chose wine colored curtains for the dining room
The wine shade complemented the room's warm tones

definitions: young person especially between childhood and adult age
period between childhood and adult age in person's life
examples: The youth volunteered at the community center regularly
Today's youth face different challenges than previous generations
She spent her youth traveling around the world
In his youth he dreamed of becoming an astronaut

definitions: state of atmosphere including temperature humidity precipitation and wind
examples: The weather forecast predicts rain throughout the weekend
Extreme weather events have become more frequent lately

definitions: substance used for treating disease or relieving pain
science and practice of diagnosing treating and preventing disease
examples: Take this medicine three times daily with food
The pharmacy stocks both prescription and over-counter medicines
She decided to study medicine at university level
Modern medicine has dramatically increased human life expectancy

definitions: long written story about imaginary characters and events
interestingly new unusual or different from typical expectations
examples: Her latest novel topped the bestseller list immediately
The novel explores themes of love and loss
Scientists developed a novel approach to cancer treatment
That's certainly a novel way of solving problems

definitions: day of week following Wednesday and preceding Friday
examples: The meeting has been scheduled for Thursday afternoon
Thursday marks the beginning of our weekend sale

definitions: act of giving something and receiving something else instead
short conversation or interaction between two or more people
place where securities commodities or currencies are traded professionally
examples: The exchange of gifts occurs during the holidays
They arranged an exchange of prisoners between countries
Their heated exchange lasted several minutes before calming
A brief exchange of greetings preceded the meeting
The stock exchange closed early due to holidays
Currency exchange rates fluctuate throughout each trading day

definitions: broad inlet of sea where land curves inward
reddish brown color especially describing horses
recessed section of room or building forming an alcove
examples: Ships anchored safely in the protected bay overnight
The bay provides habitat for numerous marine species
She rode a beautiful bay horse through the fields
The bay mare won three races this season
They added a breakfast table in the kitchen bay
The bay window offered panoramic views of gardens

definitions: final part or ending of something like speech or event
judgment or decision reached after consideration of evidence or reasoning
examples: The speaker saved the best points for the conclusion
The movie's conclusion left audiences wanting more answers
Scientists reached the conclusion after extensive research studies
Don't jump to conclusions without examining all evidence

definitions: forward or onward movement toward a destination or goal
gradual improvement or advancement in development of something over time
examples: We made good progress on the highway today
The hikers tracked their progress using GPS devices
The patient showed remarkable progress after starting therapy
Scientific progress often happens through small incremental steps

definitions: unexpected or astonishing event fact or thing that happens
feeling of mild astonishment or shock caused by something unexpected
examples: The birthday party was a complete surprise for her
Life often brings surprises both pleasant and challenging
His surprise was evident when he opened the gift
To everyone's surprise the underdog team won decisively

definitions: process of evaluating or estimating nature quality or ability of someone or something
examples: The teacher completed assessments for all thirty students
Property assessment determines the annual tax amount owed

definitions: facial expression formed by flexing muscles near mouth showing pleasure or amusement
examples: Her warm smile brightened everyone's day immediately
The photographer asked everyone to smile naturally

definitions: money in coins or notes as distinct from checks or electronic payments
examples: She prefers paying with cash rather than cards
The store offers discounts for cash payments only

definitions: unit of weight equal to sixteen ounces or 453.6 grams
basic monetary unit of United Kingdom and several other countries
enclosure where stray animals are kept until claimed or adopted
examples: The package weighs exactly five pounds including wrapping
She lost twenty pounds through diet and exercise
The item costs fifty pounds in British currency
Exchange rates affect the pound's international value significantly
They adopted their dog from the local pound
The pound holds animals for seven days minimum

definitions: set of two things used together or regarded as unit
two people related in some way or considered together
examples: She bought a new pair of running shoes
This pair of scissors needs sharpening before use
The pair worked together on the research project
What a lovely pair they make at parties

definitions: sum of money borrowed and expected to be repaid with interest
act of lending something for temporary use by another person
examples: They applied for a loan to buy their house
Student loans help finance higher education for millions
The museum received rare artifacts on loan internationally
The library allows book loans for three weeks

definitions: small community or group of houses in rural area smaller than town
examples: The village celebrates harvest festival every autumn season
Their village has maintained traditional customs for centuries

definitions: either of two equal parts into which something is divided
part of something that is approximately but not exactly equal
examples: Cut the apple in half for sharing equally
She inherited half of her grandmother's estate property
We're only half finished with the project work
The glass sat half empty on the table

definitions: set of outer clothes made of same fabric including jacket and trousers or skirt
legal proceedings brought by one party against another in court
any of four sets of playing cards distinguished by their symbols
examples: He wore his best suit to the job interview
The business suit has become less formal recently
They filed a suit against the company for damages
The suit was settled out of court last month
Hearts is the highest ranking suit in this game
She collected all cards of the same suit

definitions: what is meant by word text concept or action implying importance
definition or sense of word phrase or symbol in language
examples: The meaning of life remains humanity's greatest philosophical question
Her words carried deeper meaning than initially apparent
Look up the meaning of unfamiliar words while reading
Some words have multiple meanings depending on context

definitions: stock or amount of something available for use when needed
act of providing something that is wanted or needed by someone
examples: The supply of fresh water decreased during drought
Medical supplies arrived at the hospital this morning
They supply organic vegetables to local restaurants daily
The company will supply all necessary equipment promptly

definitions: sweet sticky yellowish-brown fluid made by bees from flower nectar
informal way of addressing someone you love or like very much
examples: She added honey to her tea for sweetness
Local honey helps some people with seasonal allergies
Honey could you please pass the salt shaker
Thanks for helping with dinner honey I appreciate it

definitions: hard whitish tissue making up skeleton in humans and vertebrate animals
examples: The x-ray showed a small fracture in the bone
Calcium helps maintain strong healthy bones throughout life

definitions: result or effect of an action or condition especially when unwelcome or unpleasant
examples: Every action has consequences whether immediate or delayed
The environmental consequences of pollution affect future generations

definitions: rule or directive made and maintained by an authority
action or process of regulating or being regulated through control
examples: New safety regulations require additional training for workers
The regulation prohibits parking during street cleaning hours
Temperature regulation keeps the building comfortable year round
The regulation of blood sugar involves multiple body systems

definitions: prize or other mark of recognition given for achievement
amount of money paid as result of legal judgment or arbitration
examples: She received the award for best actress last night
The science award recognizes outstanding research contributions annually
The court's award compensated victims for their losses
The arbitration award settled the long-running dispute finally

definitions: lowest point or part of something beneath all others
person's buttocks or the part on which one sits
examples: The keys fell to the bottom of her purse
Heavier objects sink to the bottom of water
The toddler fell and landed on his bottom
Please remain seated on your bottom during takeoff

definitions: room in school or college where lessons take place for students
examples: Students entered the classroom quietly before lessons began
The classroom had new interactive whiteboards installed recently

definitions: act of mentioning or alluding to something in speech or writing
source of information cited in research or academic work
statement regarding someone's character or qualifications typically for employment
examples: His speech made reference to recent political events
The reference to classical literature enhanced her argument
Check the references at the end of each chapter
Academic papers require proper references for all sources
Her former employer provided an excellent reference letter
Most jobs require at least two professional references

definitions: meal eaten in middle of day typically between breakfast and dinner
examples: Let's meet for lunch at the new restaurant
She packed a healthy lunch for work today

definitions: public notice or announcement promoting product service or event to attract interest
examples: The clever ad campaign increased sales by thirty percent
She skipped through ads while watching the show

definitions: strong feeling of wanting to have something or wishing for something to happen
strong sexual feeling or appetite for intimate physical connection
examples: Her desire to travel motivated years of saving
The desire for knowledge drives scientific discovery forward
Romantic novels often explore themes of love and desire
Physical desire forms part of many adult relationships

definitions: action of teaching or providing information about how to do something
detailed information telling how something should be done operated or assembled
examples: The instruction of young children requires patience and creativity
She received expert instruction in classical piano techniques
Follow the assembly instructions carefully to avoid mistakes
The medication comes with detailed instructions for use

definitions: serious unexpected and potentially dangerous situation requiring immediate action or response
examples: Call 911 immediately in case of medical emergency
The hospital emergency room stays open twenty-four hours

definitions: process of using one's mind to consider or reason about something
person's ideas or opinions about a particular subject or issue
examples: Critical thinking helps solve complex problems more effectively
The child's thinking skills develop rapidly during school years
Current thinking suggests a different approach might work better
What's your thinking on this important matter

definitions: journey for pleasure visiting several different places of interest
period of duty or service especially military service in particular location
examples: The tour included visits to five European capitals
She works as a tour guide during summer months
His tour of duty lasted eighteen months overseas
The band's tour covered forty cities across America

definitions: natural satellite of earth visible as bright disk in night sky
examples: The full moon illuminated the path through the forest
Ancient cultures created calendars based on moon phases

definitions: details of place where someone lives or organization is situated
formal speech delivered to audience on special occasion or topic
examples: Please write your address clearly on the envelope
They moved to a new address last month
The president's address focused on economic recovery plans
She delivered the graduation address to eight hundred students

definitions: twelfth and final month of year in Gregorian calendar
examples: December brings cold weather to northern regions annually
Many holidays are celebrated during December worldwide

definitions: domestic fowl kept for eggs or meat descended from jungle fowl
person who lacks courage or is easily frightened by things
examples: The farmer collected fresh eggs from the chicken coop
Roasted chicken makes a popular Sunday dinner meal
Don't be such a chicken about trying new things
He called me chicken for refusing the dare

definitions: material such as coal gas or oil burned to produce heat or power
examples: Rising fuel prices affect transportation costs significantly nationwide
Alternative fuels could reduce environmental pollution over time

definitions: cruel and violent treatment of person or animal causing harm
improper use of something in way that causes damage or harm
examples: Child abuse requires immediate intervention by protective services
The shelter helps victims escape from domestic abuse
Drug abuse can lead to serious health complications
The abuse of power by officials undermines public trust
